message_1: Compute the first cohomology group $H^1(\mathbb{R}^2\setminus\{(0,0)\},\mathbb{Z})$ of the complement of the origin in $\mathbb{R}^2$ with coefficients in integers $\mathbb{Z}$.
message_2:
To compute the first cohomology group $H^1(\mathbb{R}^2\setminus\{(0,0)\},\mathbb{Z})$, we will use the Mayer-Vietoris sequence. We will cover $\mathbb{R}^2\setminus\{(0,0)\}$ by two open sets $U$ and $V$ such that $U \cap V$ is also an open set. Let $U = \mathbb{R}^2\setminus\{(0,0)\}$ and $V = \{(x,y) \in \mathbb{R}^2 : x > -1\}$. Then $U \cap V = \{(x,y) \in \mathbb{R}^2 : x > -1, (x,y) \neq (0,0)\}$.

Now, we will compute the cohomology groups of $U$, $V$, and $U \cap V$. Since $U$ is homotopy equivalent to the circle $S^1$, we have $H^1(U,\mathbb{Z}) \cong H^1(S^1,\mathbb{Z}) \cong \mathbb{Z}$. Similarly, $V$ is homotopy equivalent to $\mathbb{R}^2$, so $H^1(V,\mathbb{Z}) \cong H^1(\mathbb{R}^2,\mathbb{Z}) \cong 0$. Finally, $U \cap V$ is homotopy equivalent to $S^1$, so $H^1(U \cap V,\mathbb{Z}) \cong H^1(S^1,\mathbb{Z}) \cong \mathbb{Z}$.

Now we can write down the Mayer-Vietoris sequence for the first cohomology groups:

$$\cdots \to H^1(U,\mathbb{Z}) \oplus H^1(V,\mathbb{Z}) \to H^1(U \cap V,\mathbb{Z}) \to H^1(\mathbb{R}^2\setminus\{(0,0)\},\mathbb{Z}) \to H^2(U,\mathbb{Z}) \oplus H^2(V,\mathbb{Z}) \to \cdots$$

Substituting the cohomology groups we computed, we get:

$$\cdots \to \mathbb{Z} \oplus 0 \to \mathbb{Z} \to H^1(\mathbb{R}^2\setminus\{(0,0)\},\mathbb{Z}) \to 0 \oplus 0 \to \cdots$$

Since $H^2(U,\mathbb{Z}) \oplus H^2(V,\mathbb{Z}) = 0$, the map $H^1(U \cap V,\mathbb{Z}) \to H^1(\mathbb{R}^2\setminus\{(0,0)\},\mathbb{Z})$ is surjective. Also, the map $\mathbb{Z} \oplus 0 \to \mathbb{Z}$ is just the identity map on $\mathbb{Z}$, so it is injective. Therefore, we have:

$$H^1(\mathbb{R}^2\setminus\{(0,0)\},\mathbb{Z}) \cong \mathbb{Z}$$
